title: Phase 0: Strict TypeScript + Effect v4 Foundation
description: Replace permissive JS/MJS execution paths with maximally strict TypeScript and Effect v4 service boundaries.

title: Inventory all JS/MJS runtime paths and migration surface
description: Enumerate all .js/.mjs modules, runtime entrypoints, and compatibility shims required for strict TS migration.

title: Publish engineering standard for strict TS + Effect usage
description: Document mandatory patterns, forbidden patterns, and migration acceptance criteria.

title: Define strict TS compiler baseline and project references
description: Create tsconfig architecture with strict=true, noUncheckedIndexedAccess, exactOptionalPropertyTypes, and project references.

title: Adopt Effect v4 service/layer architecture baseline
description: Define canonical Effect service boundaries (Storage, Retrieval, Evaluation, Policy, Ingestion).

title: Create typed domain contracts using Schema and branded IDs
description: Replace untyped payload handling with Effect Schema validators and branded identifier types.

title: Implement typed error taxonomy with TaggedError
description: Standardize recoverable/fatal/domain errors with structured Effect TaggedError hierarchy.

title: Establish runtime environment layer (Config, Logger, Clock)
description: Provide deterministic testable runtime environment via Effect layers and injectable services.

title: Set up lint and format gates for strict TS discipline
description: Enable lint rules preventing any/unsafe casts and enforce strict code hygiene.

title: Add compatibility shims for existing CLI/API entrypoints
description: Keep external interfaces stable during migration while routing internals through TS/Effect.

title: Introduce CI quality gates for typecheck/test/build
description: Fail CI on type or contract regressions and enforce deterministic test suite execution.

title: Ship single executable per platform (CLI+API in one binary)
description: Add unified entrypoint so one binary per OS supports CLI operations and API server mode; update Bun build scripts and tests.
close_reason: Implemented unified CLI+API runtime entrypoint, switched matrix builds to single binary per OS, added compiled single-binary tests, and validated with tests/build/bench.

title: Add multi-store memory ingestion for JIRA and agent conversations
description: Implement isolated memory stores and source-aware ingestion so JIRA history and coding-agent conversations can be ingested separately. Validate ingestion using /Users/satan/work/techsio-prototypes/ferndesk-connector as JIRA example and available past agent conversation artifacts.
acceptance_criteria: 1) Engine/API support multiple stores with strict isolation on ingest/recall. 2) Add JIRA ingestion path with mapping + tests. 3) Add agent-conversation ingestion path (Codex/Claude formats) + tests. 4) Add benchmark/test coverage and report of saved reflections/learnings per store. 5) Documentation for avoiding cross-project memory pollution.

title: Phase 1: SQLite Persistence + Multi-Level Scope Lattice
description: Implement enterprise data model and deterministic persistence for common/project/role/user memory scopes.

title: Design normalized SQLite schema for enterprise memory domains
description: Model tenants, scopes, users, projects, roles, memory items, evidence, and feedback with strict constraints.

title: Implement idempotency keys for write-path deduplication
description: Prevent duplicate writes across retries with deterministic operation identity.

title: Implement migration framework and deterministic schema tests
description: Add versioned migrations and replay-safe tests for schema evolution.

title: Implement Storage service repositories with Effect
description: Create repository implementations for all memory entities backed by SQLite transactions.

title: Implement scope lattice resolution (common/project/role/user)
description: Define deterministic scope precedence and inheritance rules for retrieval and writes.

title: Add tenant isolation constraints and guardrails
description: Enforce tenant boundaries at query and write layers with audited denials.

title: Add FTS5 indexes and query plans for memory search
description: Create indexed retrieval paths for scalable relevance lookup.

title: Implement evidence pointer and provenance tables
description: Guarantee every promoted memory has evidence links and immutable provenance metadata.

title: Implement append-only audit event ledger
description: Persist deterministic operation audit entries for compliance and incident analysis.

title: Implement snapshot export/import for backup and seed data
description: Provide signed deterministic export/import tooling for operational continuity.

title: Implement deterministic memory CI operations shadow_write/replay_eval/promote/demote
description: Implement deterministic memory CI operations (shadow_write/replay_eval/promote/demote) in strict TS+Effect architecture.

title: Phase 3: Retrieval Ranking + Actionable Agent Packs
description: Provide bounded, explainable retrieval packs that produce actionable tips for coding agents.

title: Define actionable retrieval pack schema
description: Specify typed output contract for do/dont/examples/risks/sources/warnings.

title: Implement multi-scope retrieval planner
description: Collect and merge memories across common/project/role/user scopes with policy checks.

title: Implement ranking formula with explicit and learned weights
description: Combine relevance, evidence strength, decay, human weight, and utility score.

title: Implement contradiction detection and timeline reconciliation
description: Detect conflicting memories and preserve chronological truth lineage.

title: Implement bounded token budget compiler for packs
description: Ensure retrieval payloads remain bounded and deterministic for coding agents.

title: Implement freshness and confidence warning annotations
description: Warn consumers about stale or low-confidence guidance.

title: Implement retrieval explainability endpoint
description: Expose why each memory item was selected and which signals influenced ranking.

title: Add end-to-end coding-agent scenario tests
description: Validate actionable guidance quality across realistic coding workflows.

title: Add persistent coding-agent history importer and learning pass
description: Ingest Codex/Claude history into shared UMS state, run reflect/validate/curate pipeline, and report learned rules/anti-patterns.
close_reason: Added persistent coding-agent-only importer, executed ingestion + learning pass, and generated learning summary report.

title: UMS docs/tests benchmark baseline for Phase 1/2 constraints and guardrails
description: Create ADR + runbook baseline constraints and Phase 1/2 scope mapping (backend-only, local-first, security defaults, no frontend) and add Node built-in unit/integration tests + benchmark harness for deterministic behavior, idempotent ingestion, bounded recall payloads, guardrails, and latency metrics.

title: Add Windows/Linux multiplatform executable builds and verify shared default state path
description: Add build scripts for Bun cross-target compiled binaries for CLI and API, validate outputs for windows/linux, and ensure CLI/API default to same state file path without env vars.
close_reason: Implemented cross-platform Bun build matrix scripts, aligned API default shared-state behavior, added regression tests, and validated with tests/build/bench.

title: Phase 5: Security, Compliance, and Policy Hardening
description: Enforce enterprise security controls, compliance exports, and policy plug-in contracts.

title: Implement RBAC model for UMS operations
description: Define and enforce admin/lead/dev/auditor permissions for memory and policy actions.

title: Enforce scope authorization matrix
description: Gate retrieval and mutation by tenant, project, role, and user access rights.

title: Implement ingestion redaction for secrets and PII
description: Sanitize sensitive content before persistence while preserving evidence traceability.

title: Implement encryption-at-rest and key rotation hooks
description: Protect persisted memory records with documented key lifecycle controls.

title: Design and implement policy pack plugin interface
description: Enable extensible policy checks through typed Effect service modules.

title: Implement compliance export pipelines
description: Generate signed NDJSON/CSV audit exports with integrity checksums.

title: Add anomaly detection and alerting rules
description: Detect harmful-signal spikes, unauthorized access attempts, and policy drift.

title: Produce security test suite and threat model
description: Codify abuse cases and validate controls with deterministic security tests.

title: Document manual and automatic ingestion paths in architecture doc
description: Clarify how data gets from agents/chat assistants into memory: manual commands and automation model.

- Each signal is linked to episode evidence and source provenance.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Harm thresholds trigger deterministic inversion rules.
- Confidence decay acceleration logic is documented and tested.
- Resulting anti-patterns preserve evidence linkage.

- Recall payloads include chronology notes for changed misconceptions.
- Notes are bounded and prioritized by relevance.
- Chronology formatting is deterministic across runs.

title: UMS P3-05 T11: Prompt-injection resistant personalization curation
description:
Harden personalization curation so untrusted instructions cannot become procedural truths without validation.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Untrusted instruction patterns are blocked or quarantined by policy.
- Promotion to procedural memory requires validation evidence.
- Security tests cover injection-like payloads.

title: UMS P3-05 T12: Cross-space allowlist enforcement for learner recall
description:
Enforce explicit allowlists for any cross-space learner-memory retrieval in tutoring workflows.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Cross-space recalls require allowlist authorization by policy.
- Unauthorized cross-space requests fail with clear error semantics.
- Access checks are covered by integration tests.

title: UMS P3-05 T13: Degraded-mode tutoring behavior without LLM/index
description:
Define and implement degraded-mode responses for personalization/tutoring when LLM providers or indices are unavailable.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Core tutoring flows remain operational in degraded mode.
- Degraded responses include explicit capability flags/warnings.
- Fallback behavior is tested for deterministic output.

title: UMS P3-05 T14: Personalization policy audit export and checklist
description:
Create audit export templates and operational checklist for personalization policy compliance and incident review.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Audit exports include policy decision traceability.

title: Design SQLite-to-Postgres migration strategy
description: Plan schema portability, migration tooling, and dual-run verification path.

title: Implement pluggable storage adapter contracts
description: Support SQLite and Postgres backends behind strict storage interfaces.

title: Evaluate optional vector retrieval extension
description: Assess vector-search augmentation while preserving deterministic fallback behavior.

title: Design cross-repo memory federation model
description: Enable controlled sharing of memory across repositories/teams with policy enforcement.

title: Plan enterprise SSO/SCIM integration
description: Define identity lifecycle and role sync contracts for enterprise customers.

title: Design disaster-recovery game day automation
description: Automate restore drills and resilience validation workflows.

title: Create UMS system diagram
Improve rule quality with heuristic lesson extraction
description: Replace low-value source-preference rule generation with directive/lesson extraction and anti-pattern feedback signals for coding-agent history.

title: Phase 2: Memory Lifecycle + Feedback Control Plane
description: Deliver shadow_write/replay_eval/promote/demote lifecycle with explicit human weighting and outcome feedback loops.

title: Implement shadow candidate write API contract
description: Create strict endpoint and service logic for candidate memory writes into shadow state.

title: Add lifecycle replay-safety integration tests
description: Verify shadow/eval/promote/demote determinism under repeated and reordered requests.

title: Emit lifecycle observability metrics and traces
description: Publish metrics for candidate throughput, gate pass rate, demotion reasons, and latency.

title: Implement replay evaluation scoring engine
description: Compute net value score and safety deltas from replay and canary metrics.

title: Implement gated promotion flow
description: Promote only candidates with passing evaluations and fresh evidence links.

title: Implement deterministic demotion flow
description: Demote candidates/rules on sustained negative net value or explicit harmful feedback.

title: Implement explicit /addweight command and API
description: Allow humans to increase/decrease memory influence with reasoned audit trail.

title: Implement helpful/harmful feedback ingestion
description: Ingest agent/user outcome feedback and map it to memory utility signals.

title: Implement incident escalation signal endpoint
description: Capture severe failure events and trigger immediate memory quarantine paths.

title: Implement candidate expiry and decay scheduler
description: Apply deterministic temporal decay without destructive data loss.

title: Implement manual quarantine and override controls
description: Provide operator controls for emergency suppress/promote actions with auditability.
